abstract: Movie ticket sales over the holiday weekend dip from the previous year, a look at Adbuster magazine’s role in starting the Occupy Wall Street movement and more media news.
snippet: Movie ticket sales over the holiday weekend dip from the previous year, a look at Adbuster magazine’s role in starting the Occupy Wall Street movement and more media news.
lead_paragraph: Ticket sales for Hollywood’s five-day Thanksgiving sales period — an important springboard to Christmas — totaled about $234 million, an 11 percent decline from the period a year earlier, Brooks Barnes reported. The No. 1 film was a holdover, “The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn — Part 1” (Summit Entertainment), which took in an estimated $62.3 million during the long weekend. It had a two-week total of $221.3 million, according to Hollywood.com, which compiles ticket data. At No. 2 was a new release, “The Muppets” (Walt Disney Studios), which had estimated ticket sales of $42 million.
